snippet: Chun Hsien Deng, 19, a freshman, was on a retreat with 30 or so members of the Pi Delta Psi fraternity, the Monroe County, Pa., district attorney’s office said.
abstract: Law enforcement officials in Pennsylvania are investigating death of 19-year-old Baruch College freshman Chun Hsien Deng, who died while on retreat with members of Pi Delta Psi fraternity in the Poconos; authorities say Deng suffered major brain trauma while taking part in game during fraternity hazing ritual.

byline.original: By ARIEL KAMINER and ASHLEY SOUTHALL
byline.contributor: Jack Begg and Susan C. Beachy contributed research, and Julie Turkewitz contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: Chun Hsien Deng, 19, a freshman, was on a retreat with 30 or so members of the Pi Delta Psi fraternity, the Monroe County, Pa., district attorney’s office said.

headline.main: Baruch College Student Dies in Fraternity Pledge Ritual in Poconos
headline.print_headline: Baruch College Student Dies After Fraternity Ritual in Poconos
